Dictionary

eq·ui·ty    an·a·lyt·ix

/ ˈekwədē/ /ˌanəˈlidiks /

noun

1.

The science of extracting and examining raw financial and equity data with the purpose of finding patterns and drawing conclusions from that information through the application of an algorithmic, technological and/or mechanical process in order to derive insights.

2.

A financial data boutique providing event-driven traders with the earliest mention of relevant, actionable, market-moving news, analytics, and trading insights.

Translations, word origins, and more definitions

Data Mining |
Content & Analytix
Identify Relevant Data

Breaking news, off-the-radar content, pre-viral stories, rumors, hit pieces, hit tweets, takeover chatter, share buybacks, TV and article pumps & dumps, FDA notices/announcements, up/down grades, vol pop/drop, vol expansion/breakout, social, media, equity and order flow analytics, drug/medical device efficacy, patent data, accidents and catastrophes, fraud, sympathy plays, price-target updates, conference call updates and cancellations, insider buying, offerings, SEC filings, and press releases.

Filters
Apply Human Review

After applying real-time filtering and analysis to identify relevant data, we then review the data for timing, exposure, and source reliability. Depending on the name, we may analyze and further filter the data for any or some of the following: price, percentage change, liquidity, momentum, volatility, chart pattern, support/resistance, bid-ask spread, market impact, price range, index levels, forecasts, and trend.

Alert
Curated Data

Once data meets our filtering requirements, it’s deemed actionable and becomes a curated alert ready for delivery.

Delivery
For Traders

We deliver our curated data alerts to traders via any one or all three of our event-driven feeds (EDFs).

Scanners - Indicators - Analytix |
Media Scanners |

No single event can move the markets or affect a stock’s liquidity and price as much as breaking news! Knowing this data first can provide traders with an edge. Equity Analytix provides this edge by delivering the earliest possible mention of critical breaking news and data points, thereby enabling traders to take advantage of these events as they happen in real time.

Media Monitoring

We monitor many traditional and social media sources, including Twitter, StockTwits, television, internet, news wires, analysts, top publishers, traders, researchers, and thinkers.

Twittersphere Scanner

We utilize a Twittersphere scanner that accesses and searches the global Twitter fire hose, specifically looking for the earliest mention of relevant actionable content.

TweetStream

Our in-house social media scanner, “TweetStream,” distributes streaming data points garnered from a curated list, which includes some of the most informed, trusted, and influential data sources on Twitter. Modified for intelligent notification, TweetStream helps us quickly discover high-impact events and critical breaking information.

Leveraged Streams and Protected Tweet Access

We leverage the curated Twitter streams of others and access the protected/private tweets from still other relevant Twitter influencers.

Order Flow Scanner |

Our order flow scanner captures streaming real-time order flow data from the financial exchanges, while its proprietary algorithms perform a series of quantitative analyses that search for and identify specific, unusual options activity.

Unusual Options Activity

Order flow analysis uncovers the hidden Unusual Options Activity (UOA) that exists within market shadows. UOA is an amazingly accurate leading indicator that can often provide a strong signal of an imminent and/or potential large move in the underlying stock and/or option.

Track Smart Money

Unusual Options Activity reveals and tracks the “smart money” order flow in real time. The “smart money” is made up of trading syndicates, hedge funds, and investment banks, which control the large majority of money in the markets. They have the resources, technology, and insider knowledge that give them an advantage or an “insider's edge” over “retail.”

Real-Time Insight

The institutional-grade technology within our order flow scanner helps level the trading field by providing real-time trading insight and a tradeable edge that savvy retail traders can exploit.

Equity Scanner |

Our real-time equity scanner continuously tracks the stock market using algorithmic-based technology and proprietary scans to locate first mover and outlier trading alerts.

NinjaTrader Indicators |

Equity Analytix subscribers receive access to our real-time indicator package, which runs on the free NinjaTrader 7/8 platform. Included are a suite of non-correlated real-time trend exhaustion indicators, each of which is uniquely calculated and calibrated to identify possible market reaction/inflection points in non-trending markets.

Coming Soon
Market Analytix |

To aid us in forecasting market direction, we evaluate an agglomeration of S&P & NQ market data, which includes some or all of the following:

  • Analyzing the market maker code via footprints left by the auction system and their algorithms.
  • Analyzing dark pool data and HFT for the hidden algorithmic trading data and market patterns that lie within the coding.
  • Integrating LEADING harmonic time, price, pattern, and cycle research derived from esoteric market geometry.
  • Applying inter-market divergence and projection analysis.
  • Between the two market indexes, we utilize a daily collective of more than 400 key price levels that we derive from multiple formulas, variable sets, and time frames. These pivot levels, some of which are hidden, are used as a predictive tool of future market movement. They propagate from a series of calculations that determine a variety of relevant support/resistance levels that the futures market will likely respect in the coming trading session.
  • As the market unfolds in real time, we supplement our analytics with ongoing intraday analysis and commentary, which includes evolving auction market levels, Fibonacci retracement and extension levels, potential reversal zones (PRZ), candlestick analysis, market patterns and directional forecast alerts. Add period@end of sentence on website
  • Importantly, each respective piece in our overall cache of data and analytics is developed independently from one another, and each has merit in its own right. However, when aspects of the data fall into alignment or confluence with one another, we believe the output of our analysis becomes more relevant and frequently more accurate.

SCROLL DOWN

Pre-Market Analytix |

To help traders prepare for the upcoming trading session, we provide pre-market analytix every morning at 9:00 AM EST. Included within are relevant directional market forecasts, important market support and resistance levels, after-hours and pre-market news/headlines, notable analyst actions, and the daily economic calendar.

Powered by Data, Filtered and Curated by Humans |

Streaming raw data powers our incoming feeds, but gobs of raw data provide a
crowded picture of unformed information waiting to be interpreted by you the
perceiver. Input data filtering only helps narrow down and uncover some
of what’s relevant, but not necessarily what’s tradeable. Human
filtering, interpretation, and curation finds and transforms
relevant data into actionable intelligence more precisely.

In this age of information overload, focusing on what
really matters is key. So it goes without saying that
as an event-driven trader, not every headline or data
point is worth your attention, and not every
stock is worthy of a trade. Still, most
financial newswires and analytics
platforms provide a fire hose
of raw data and research that
delivers some actionable
data buried within it,
but in our experience
as event-driven traders,
this still requires
an editor.....

someone to monitor, read, analyze, and process the data in order to quickly
find those nuggets worthy of an actionable status.

We Filter Out the Noise, So You Don’t Have To

Before any of our significant events data can become
an alert, we filter out over 90% of the noise
(distracting, non-essential, or irrelevant
information). We then take our filtered data
and by way of human review, distill it
into relevant, market-moving, actionable
trading data. With relevant
nformation in hand, we
then deliver it as fast
as possible to traders
via any one or all three
of our custom
event-driven feeds.

VIEW MORE

Intelligent, Event-Driven Feeds |

In the financial arena, you’re only as good as your technology, your data, and the speed with which you deliver that data. Our intuitive event-driven feeds (EDFs) are keyed into these elements to help keep traders
ahead of the game. Choose any one or all of the following deployment options.

squawKAST

A squawk audio feed delivering relevant, real-time breaking news, data, order flow, analytics, and trading insights.

Learn More

Listen for Trading Opportunities

With traders usually fixed on their screens, anxiety, fatigue, stress, and eye burnout can easily set in. Therefore, the ability to audibly process relevant and actionable content can prove invaluable to a trader.

We Squawk Breaking Data
So You Don’t Have To Read It

squawKAST frees up the mind, eyes, and mouse, allowing traders the freedom to focus their attention on the markets, their trading charts, and trading terminal. This, in turn, enables traders to react more quickly and more confidently to up-to-the-second market events.

flashKAST

A proprietary messaging platform that delivers real-time breaking news, data, order flow, analytics, and trading insights.

Learn More

See What You Hear

Developed in-house, flashKAST is a unique, intuitively designed, interactive data feed in which incoming messages flash and pulse until they’re acknowledged, deleted, or expire. This process allows for a slim messaging client with a small screen footprint.

Know Alert Bias Before You Read It

Each incoming message is color formatted to display a positive or negative sentiment. All messages also include an attached audio signature that’s directionally biased.

pushKAST

A configurable push/desktop notification client that delivers real-time breaking news, data, order flow, analytics, and trading insights.

Learn More Coming Soon

View Pop-Up Alerts

pushKast runs entirely out of view, allowing only push notifications to pop up on your screen. These notifications are user-customizable for exact screen placement, size, and time-delineated dissolve.

Push Notifications Provide
a ZERO Screen Footprint

With no user interface and messages that display on screen only when alerted, pushKAST requires minimal intermittent screen space, thereby enabling traders to maximize their “screen estate.”

Designed and Developed for Traders |
Designed and Developed for
Traders
Trading
|

The blueprint for Equity Analytix was derived from the design and development of specialized software tools created to meet our own trading needs. We later adapted and enhanced these “wares” and furthered new ones to meet the data and delivery needs of traders who now depend on our event-driven feeds (EDFs).

Development aside, EDFs from Equity Analytix are distinctly different from other data streams on the market. Specifically, there are ten key differentiators that separate our feeds from similar-but-not-quite-alike services.

BIASED DATA ALERTS

Equity Analytix is not a news wire, nor is it a chat/signal room/service. Instead, our data feeds are similar to an amalgamation of the two. Specifically, we’re an aggregator of event-driven data that, in lieu of chatting, streaming news, or issuing trading signals, delivers biased data alerts and market analysis.

TRADER MADE SOFTWARE

Software technology and automation has the ability to empower traders to become more profitable. This being the case, we’ve built intelligent software that helps traders better receive, visualize, and understand our data. Most of our software tools (personal trading API, alert notification, messaging, indicators, and media posting apps) are unique, proprietary, and TRADER MADE³, i.e., MADE by a trader, MADE for traders, and MADE for trading! (Read “Our Story” to learn more about how our specialized tools and service were developed and came into existence.)

Our messaging clients come with advanced functionality, which provides flexible and customizable alert delivery solutions that afford traders choices on how their data is received and consumed. Traders can utilize any one or all three of our event-driven feeds. Within these feeds, we provide interactive text alerts, color-coded icon proxies (icons used in lieu of and in addition to written and audible data alerts), customizable push notifications, pre-warning audible alarms, alert counters, incoming alert placement (top or bottom of chat client), choice of incoming alert color flash, number of flashes, number of alert rings, type of ring, and so on.

TWITTER “GAME” ON LOCK

Breaking news is typically broken by one source, either through traditional media channels or on Twitter. Subsequent news outlets, services, and individuals who pick up these events vary in the speed with which they pull, share, and/or redistribute it on Twitter. Equity Analytix has mastered the art of extracting Twitter data so well that we often joke, “We’ve got this Twitter game on lock.” Others have agreed, saying that our speed in harvesting and redistributing Twitter data is second to none! Perhaps that’s because we use expensive “locate” data, we follow an extensive and trusted list of sources, and we “view” the data differently than most.

OFF-RADAR DATA SOURCES

In addition to sourcing quality, top-tier content from many of Wall Street’s most prominent, reliable, and influential news, research, and data outlets, we also aggregate differentiated data from a few little-known off-radar sources.

RELEVANT DATA FLOW

While many data outlets and trading services offer and provide everything to every type of trader/investor, our focal point is on doing one thing and doing that one thing VERY well—delivering relevant analytics to traders. To this end, we search the financial dataverse to collect, process, contextualize, and report only the most compelling, relevant, market-moving, actionable trading data. After sifting the nuggets from the noise, we deliver approximately 100 data alerts per day from 9:30 - 4:00 PM EST.

HYPERFAST ALERTS

Time is a key element in day trading; seconds count! Therefore, the speed and ease with which a trader receives and acts upon market-moving event data is paramount and could be the difference between making or losing money. Since time is of the essence, we place our primary emphasis on the speed of data extraction, as well as the delivery of our alerts. In doing so, we employ proprietary notification technology, which gives us the ability to detect and deliver breaking data faster than others and often before it breaks mainstream. In this way, we’re likely able to process more data from many sources and do it more quickly and efficiently than you or others as an aggregate likely could. Faster for us means faster TO you!

DATA/SYMBOL SYNCHING

Unlike a typical newswire or analytics service that publishes any and all data as if it were a random bot, Equity Analytix evaluates actionable data from a trader’s perspective. Upon actionable data detection, we make an effort to sync our data to the stock(s)/symbol(s) whose performance is most likely to react with the greatest price impact. We do this by alerting traders to sympathy and relation plays: stocks within the same or opposing sector/industry reacting to or moving in sympathy with the data and/or one other.

NAME ANALYSIS

Equity Analytix distributes data alerts only after subjective layers of filtering, one of which may include a form of human curation we call “Name Analysis.” With Name Analysis, we take relevant filtered data, data that’s potentially actionable, and we analyze its associated stock, aka the “Name.” We often run and evaluate the Name against multiple data points to determine if the stock is worthy of a trade. No matter how compelling the data, if the setup in the Name is not ideal in our eyes, we toss the data and leave you in peace. Name Analysis, while subjective in nature, allows us to filter out the majority of relevant data due to our assignment of an “untradeable” stock designation.

FASTER DATA INTERPRETATION

DATA/TRADING SIMPLIFICATION

You can monitor and filter a rack of noisy data streams on your own, but why would you want to? To do it as quickly, efficiently, and effortlessly as possible and still catch as much actionable breaking data as possible, you would need access to the right data sources, numerous data feeds, more than two eyeballs, custom software, and multiple monitors. You’d have to remain in constant focus at all times and avoid getting overwhelmed and confused by a mountain of data. Your eyes would remain glued to your trading screens scanning, reading, and filtering a non-stop streaming flow of data, while you search for that next big headline or data point to drop.

In contrast, leveraging our intelligent, centralized data feeds to power your data-driven strategies may just be THE solution if you’re looking to simplify your day trading and data processing life. Our data consumption experience of data cleansing, frees you to do what you do best—analysis and trading!

Our Story

Over the years, we as traders have sampled numerous news and analytics trading services and what we’ve found was that no current solution totally worked for us and our style of trading. Every service we tried, disappointed us with something; others dissatisfied us in all respects, including how each and every interface displayed and delivered data. We thought, “Dagnabbit, who in the heck are designing these programs?” Well, as is generally the case with many companies—policies, rules, processes, and design are often made by someone up top, far removed from the actual use/user of the service.

Knowing this and in an effort to make better use of these trading services, we thought to ourselves, “Let's share our ideas with these companies and maybe they will be receptive enough to include them into their programs.” So, on a handful of occasions, we provided a few of them with our recommendations and design requests. One company did implement some of our ideas, another said they would think about including our designs in a further update, while yet another wouldn’t even acknowledge our email.

Frustrated with our trading needs not being met, we set out to solve some of these challenges by designing solutions to create performance and usability improvements within our own trading. Specifically, we wanted better automation and more customization so as to help us more easily and quickly navigate the sea of available financial data.

Months later, we had multiple early stage programs in use that had proven significantly more helpful in our daily trading. In fact, we were so impressed and happy with our tools, we had thought about possibly leasing them to other traders. Unfortunately, after careful consideration, a bit of forward thinking, and for various reasons, we decided against that route.

With a software release out of the question, our thoughts then turned to possibly creating an alternative method to share our software benefits with other traders. So, we looked at what we had, pondered over what we could further build out, and compared that against the aggregate data and trading service market. And it quickly became obvious that we could definitely do it in a fast, unique and what some may consider an improved format.

Before pushing our ideas and efforts into further development, we toyed around with a proof-of-concept on StockTwits. We believe we did rather well, and among some of the trolls, a few appreciatives provided some user feedback that we now share on our website. Later, after more development, refinement, and testing of our programs, we decided to share them—along with our ideas, and opinions via a trading analytics service.

Our Mission

We set out to make the complex simple by creating an easy-to-use and informative service focused on providing real-time, actionable intelligence filtered and curated by humans. Specifically, our mission was to find the best sources for real-time analytics, the ones worthy of your attention, and assess the quality and merit of that data through the lens of experienced traders. With actionable trading data in hand, our objective was to create and use better technology to discover and deliver data fast, faster than others, as fast as possible, and send it in a unique format where one can more easily process, consume, and then act on this data more quickly.

Mission Accomplished.
Equity Analytix Was Born!

Name Analysis

Depending on the name, we may analyze and further filter the data for any or some of the following: price, percentage change, liquidity, momentum, volatility, chart pattern, support/resistance, bid-ask spread, market impact, price range, index levels, forecasts and trend.

Refund & Billing Policy

As the item you are purchasing is digital service, by accessing our data feed, you have taken ownership of and “consumed” our data and analysis, therefore we cannot offer refunds due to a change of mind. We strongly encourage you to review our website in its entirety to be sure our service fits your needs before joining our group.

Your subscription will be renewed and billed automatically to your credit card on a monthly basis. As a courtesy, we may provide a reminder notification email one week prior to your rebilling.You are responsible for notifying Equity Analytix to cancel your subscription. You may cancel your subscription at any time of the month up to three days before contract renewal by contacting support. Certain refund requests may be considered on a case-by-case basis and granted at the sole discretion of Equity Analytix. Failing to cancel your subscription in a timely fashion is not one of them.

Free Trial?

One of the biggest motivations for offering a free trial to prospective customers is the obvious one: It reduces the risk to the customer in order to determine if a service meets his or her needs. The idea is to get as many prospects as possible to try your service by showing how it can benefit them, and in turn, they get to try before they buy without any risk. All this is done with the hope of generating more sales.

There’s really nothing to argue here….except, we do not provide a one-size-fits-all type of service—Our service is not designed for the broader investment or trading market. Instead, we’re a small boutique firm offering a specialized service to a very limited and targeted user base; event-driven/catalyst traders. Since our target market is very focused, we have no desire to sell to everyone in the “Tradersphere.” Instead, we’re more fixated with creating a narrow list of very happy users, than we are with registering any and every visitor to our site just for financial gain.

In keeping, we, like you, may believe that if a company doesn't offer a free trial, it probably has something to hide, might be shady, even illegitimate, or their service may not be as good as they tout. Further, you may also believe that said companies may be vying for a money grab via sales to the unknowing and the unsuspecting, thereby having no real concern whether their service truly meets your needs. While these thoughts and beliefs are quite understandable, maybe even normal, they do not ring true with our firm.

We believe that while receiving a free trial is always nice, providing one isn’t necessarily the best marketing strategy to explain, inform and showcase one’s service. Instead, we believe that an upfront honest, detailed, and properly conveyed value proposition is all that’s needed to address and alleviate any and all fears, doubts and uncertainties as to whether our service is a match for any of our visitors.

In order to more easily help a qualified prospective client make a more informed and assured decision, we have chosen to be as informative and transparent as possible. We aim to achieve this openness in three ways:

  1. Descriptive Service Offering - Through our website, we provide a clear, concise, and very detailed description of our service.
  2. Daily Transcript - Upon request, we will make available a daily transcript, which provides a synopsis of all of our previous day’s time-stamped data alerts.
  3. Demo Video - We present a demonstration video on our website which displays our data feed and all of its intricacies in action.

With the availability of these three data points, traders can clearly understand and see not only how our service works, but also how it has “performed’ in the past. In essence, we’re giving traders the opportunity to thoroughly examine and make sense of every aspect of our service before subscribing, thereby hopefully preventing any sort of buyer's remorse.

We make all this information available to our potential clients in lieu of a free trial so as to create a better, more informed consumer and minimize the possibility of acquiring an unhappy one. Our hope is that our upfront, detailed, and honest approach will help guide potential clients in the right direction. If that direction is one in which we lose a possible subscriber, so be it.

Our desire is not to take on each and every indiscriminate visitor to our website. To the contrary, we’re here to provide a premium service to a select group of experienced, event-driven traders who are not only searching for a service like the one we offer, but can immediately appreciate and perceive the value in what we provide.

As we push forward, we intend to focus on building an audience through visitor self prequalification via a foundation of trust, value, honesty, and total transparency. As we accomplish this, we believe that our description of service will sell itself.

Faster Data Interpretation

Incoming Information

As a trader, your cognitive skills—attention, auditory, focus, awareness, visual, logic, reasoning, and decision-making—all play an important role in analyzing potential trades, managing risk, and processing complex information. If these skills are weak, average, or are without external aids, your abilities are limited. As such, no matter how input data arrives, whether it’s timely, delayed, or even overlooked, your ability to make instantaneous and/or quick trading decisions is diminished, creating missed trading opportunities and impacting your trading performance.

Fine-Tuned Cognitive Process

Our software features were designed to enhance a trader’s cognitive abilities, the benefits of which are achieved through the use of icon proxies and sentiment analysis, both aspects of our data curation process. To quickly process our alerts, we present icons in lieu of and in addition to presenting textual data. Similar to icon proxies, we also apply sentiment analysis where we quickly summarize our data, before attaching a visual bias and audio perspective to it prior to delivery. Using these two software features and upon receiving an alert, traders can immediately determine the type of incoming data point as well as its bias before reading and processing any of the written text.

Trading Efficiency

Sentiment and Name Analysis, Data/Symbol Synching and Icon Proxies help us analyze and structure data for consumption by traders. More specifically, these features endeavor to bridge the relationship between breaking data and trading reaction so that traders can absorb data more quickly and quickly capitalize on opportunities. By reducing the time it takes to mentally process raw data, our simple yet logical data structuring should help improve trading efficiency and create an improved trading mindset, inevitably resulting in quicker, more confident, more decisive, and more accurate trading decisions.
